meanings.definition: A difficult, unpleasant, or embarrassing situation
meanings.sent1: Being lost in the unfamiliar city was a real predicament for the young girl.
meanings.sent2: She found herself in a predicament when she forgot her homework at home.
meanings.sent3: The predicament of wearing mismatched socks to school made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His predicament of being stuck in traffic felt like being trapped in a maze.
meanings.sent5: The predicament of having two conflicting appointments was truly stressful.

meanings.sent1: The hiker faced a predicament when he encountered a bear on the trail.
meanings.sent2: Navigating through the dense forest proved to be a predicament for the group.
meanings.sent3: Trying to juggle too many tasks at once created a predicament for the busy student.
meanings.sent4: The detective found himself in a predicament while chasing the suspect through the alleyways.
meanings.sent5: The predicament of crossing the river on a shaky bridge was nerve-wracking.

meanings.sent1: Choosing between two equally appealing options can be a predicament.
meanings.sent2: The team faced a predicament when they had to decide on a strategy for the game.
meanings.sent3: The predicament of whether to study for the test or go to the party was tough.
meanings.sent4: She found herself in a predicament when she had to pick only one dessert from the menu.
meanings.sent5: The predicament of having to choose between honesty and loyalty weighed heavily on his mind.
